definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To place in an attitude or fixed position, for the sake of effect.
examples: To pose a model for a picture.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To ask ; to set (a test, quiz, riddle, etc.).
( transitive ) To constitute (a danger, a threat, a risk, etc.).
( transitive , in the phrase "to pose as" ) To falsely impersonate (another person or occupation) primarily for the purpose of accomplishing something or reaching a goal.
( intransitive ) To assume or maintain a pose; to strike an attitude.
( intransitive ) To behave affectedly in order to attract interest or admiration .
( obsolete , transitive ) To interrogate ; to question .
( obsolete , transitive ) To question with a view to puzzling; to embarrass by questioning or scrutiny; to bring to a stand.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To place in an attitude or fixed position, for the sake of effect.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To ask ; to set (a test, quiz, riddle, etc.).
( transitive ) To constitute (a danger, a threat, a risk, etc.).
( transitive , in the phrase "to pose as" ) To falsely impersonate (another person or occupation) primarily for the purpose of accomplishing something or reaching a goal.
( intransitive ) To assume or maintain a pose; to strike an attitude.
( intransitive ) To behave affectedly in order to attract interest or admiration .
( obsolete , transitive ) To interrogate ; to question .
( obsolete , transitive ) To question with a view to puzzling; to embarrass by questioning or scrutiny; to bring to a stand.

definitions.definition: to puzzle, non-plus, or embarrass with difficult questions.

main_definition: ( obsolete ) To ask (someone) questions; to interrogate .
secondary_definitions: ( now rare ) to puzzle, non-plus, or embarrass with difficult questions.
( now rare ) To perplex or confuse (someone).
